name: John Pirman
biography:
Free lance illustrator and graphic designer. Relocated to New York from Ohio home after graduation.
Bachelor's degree, Kent State University.
Cites design influence of Paul Rand, with whom he studied in university-sponsored summer program in Swizerland.
Work has been featured in magazines such as Wallpaper, Jane, etc.
Clients have included Estee Lauder, Henri Bendel, Target, Neiman Marcus et al.
Has designed greeting cards for the Museum of Modern Art gift catalogue.
Has collected shopping bags for many years. Collection includes complete duplicate set of Bloomingdale's bags as well as many Fiorucci bags. 
Source: Personal communication from designer.
